Date Formatting and Coercion

Source: R/utils_dates.R
date_formatting.Rd

These functions handle date formatting and coercion to ensure consistency in date representations throughout the application. This is particularly important when working with dates from different sources or in different formats.

The following functions are defined:

  • coerce_date(): Coerces a date string to a Date object.

  • entrata_date(): Formats a Date object in Entrata's date format (MM/DD/YYYY).

  • parse_entrata_date(): Parses a date string in Entrata's date format.

  • http_date(): Creates an HTTP date following the RFC 1123 format.

Usage

coerce_date(date)

http_date(str)

entrata_date(date)

parse_entrata_date(date)

See also

leasing_week, pre_lease_season

Other Date Utilities: get_weeks_left_to_lease(), leasing_period, leasing_week, month_dates, pre_lease_season, utils_dates, weekly_period

Examples

coerce_date("2025-01-15")
entrata_date(Sys.Date())
